snippet: American assertions that the Islamist siege of Yazidis stranded on Mount Sinjar had been broken were disputed by a Yazidi leader and United Nations officials.
abstract: Yazidi leaders and United Nations officials strongly dispute American assertions that Islamist siege of Yazidis stranded on Mount Sinjar has been broken; Vian Dakhil, Iraqi member of Parliament and Yazidi leader who was injured in helicopter crash while delivering aid to the mountain, estimates that 70,000 to 80,000 Yazidis remain trapped on the southern flanks of Mount Sinjar.

byline.contributor: Sebnem Arsu contributed reporting from Istanbul; Kamil Kakol from Dohuk, Iraq; and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: American assertions that the Islamist siege of Yazidis stranded on Mount Sinjar had been broken were disputed by a Yazidi leader and United Nations officials.

headline.main: Despite U.S. Claims, Yazidis Say Crisis Is Not Over
